tagline: DDoS/Dos monitor using the access log file from apache web server.
body:
## Welcome DDoS Reporter
It detects attacks and based on the IPs recognized DDoSReporter can send emails to all
SYSADMs registered and/or block the access following a _iptables_ rule.

## Project

Final work for the Python for Linux Administrators course, provided by Instituto Federal de Educação, Ciência e Tecnologia do Sudeste de Minas, Campus Barbacena. Developed by Mateus Ferreira Silva this project had as theme implement a DoS/DDoS monitor for the web server Apache.

### Main topics (basics functionalities)

- Implement a real time DoS/DDoS monitor for the web server Apache. The program should periodically read the access logs of the web server, and in case of anomalies (mass access), detect the IP or IPs involved in the attack.
- When an attack is detected, it should sent an email to the network administrator (given in the configuration file) warning that a DoS or DDoS attack is ongoing and the IPs involved.
- In the configuration file should be possible to determine, in addition to information such as email, if the IP(s) that is(are) conducting the attack is(are) going to be blocked by a _DROP_ rule of _iptables_.

## How to use

1. Configure the file _settings.py_ with the right information
1. Execute the file _ddos_reporter.py_

Those files are located inside the _ddosreporter_ folder
